Song: Can't help falling in love
Artist: Elvis Presley
Composers: George David Weiss,
Hugo Peretti and Luigi Creatore 

Tabbed by DJ
23rd July 2015

Time signature: 12/8

CAPO: 2nd fret 
(Will then sound in the original recorded key of D)

The original 1961 studio recording is in D. 
With any live versions the key varies: the 1968
NBC-TV special is in C, as is a 1973 concert too. 
In another live concert in 1972 he sings it in C#
(Capo at 1st fret to match that one).

content.text:
Hotel California is the title song from the Eagles' album of the same name and was
released as a single in February 1977. Three months after its release, the single
was certified Gold by the Recording Industry Association of America. The Eagles
also won the 1977 Grammy Award for Record of the Year for "Hotel California" at
the 20th Grammy Awards in 1978. The song is rated highly in many rock music lists
and polls; Rolling Stone magazine ranked it number 49 on its list of "The 500
Greatest Songs of All Time".

[ch]Dsus2[/ch] 000230                 But 6 String guitar is more than OK as well. 
[ch]A9[/ch] 042000                    These are the precise chords Don Felder
[ch]C[/ch] 032010                     used to write the music. If you play it with 
[ch]G[/ch] 320003                     an electric guitar add Chorus & Reverb to 
[ch]Am7[/ch] 002010                   simulate the original Pitch.

content.text:
All I Want for Christmas is You
by Mariah Carey

There're several chordcharts for this song, but all of them seem to kind of miss something,
whether it's a chord, or simply get something wrong. I'm hoping mine gives you the best of all.

Standard tuning, no capo. Key of G, typical for Soprano singers.
See below for vocal guide for key selection.

Chord voicings I use (All open unless otherwise noted):

G:         320033 
Gmaj7:     354433 (Emaj7-shape Barre on 3)
C:         X32010 
D:         XX0232 
Bm11:      X20230 
Am7-5/Eb:  X6758X  Another chart calls this Cm6/Eb and voices it XX1213. I find mine easier on the fingers.
B/D#:      X64442 (A/C# - shape Barre on 2) If you struggle with this, you can voice it open as X6444X
G/D:       XX0022 
E7:        020100 
Am7:       X02213 
D7:        XX0212 
Cm:        X35543 (Am - shape Barre on 3)
D#:        X65343 (C  - shape Barre on 3) Alternatively, X68886 (A - shape Barre on 6)
Em9:       022032 (if tricky, play Em7, as 022030)

content.text:
Note: to play the chorus correctly and simulate the piano playing, keep the G on the third fret of the
high e string fretted with your pinky. This makes the chords G major, Am7, Fadd9, and C major.
I also suggest playing a Hendrix Fadd9, so wrap your thumb and play 1st fret low E string.

The strum pattern for Intro/Verse/Transition is picked for the downs and strummed for the ups.
I suggest picking the A and D strings, and then up strum.


[Intro]

[ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 1]

[ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]     [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
   I hurt myself today   to see if I still feel
  [ch]C[/ch]    [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]          [ch]Am[/ch]
I focus on the pain   the only thing that's real
    [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
The needle tears a hole   the old familiar sting
       [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]           [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]          
Try to kill it all away   but I remember everything


[Chorus]

[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]     [ch]C[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
What have I become?     My sweetest friend
[ch]Am[/ch]          [ch]F[/ch]             [ch]C[/ch]        [ch]G[/ch]
Everyone I know  goes away in the end
    [ch]Am[/ch]                 [ch]F[/ch]    [ch]G[/ch]               [ch]G[/ch]
And you could have it all   My empire of dirt
[ch]Am[/ch]              [ch]F[/ch]      [ch]G[/ch]                [ch]Am[/ch]
I will let you down    I will make you hurt


[Transition]

([ch]Am[/ch])   [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]  [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]  [ch]D[/ch]


[Verse 2]

[ch]Am[/ch]   [ch]C[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]        [ch]C[/ch]      [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
   I wear this crown of thorns   upon my liar's chair
[ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]       [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]    [ch]Am[/ch]
Full of broken thoughts   I cannot repair
  [ch]C[/ch]          [ch]D[/ch]        [ch]Am[/ch]         [ch]C[/ch]       [ch]D[/ch]       [ch]Am[/ch]
Beneath the stains of time   the feelings disappear
[ch]C[/ch]         [ch]D[/ch]      [ch]Am[/ch]    [ch]C[/ch]     [ch]D[/ch]           [ch]G[/ch]
You are someone else   I am still right here

I have taken the best of the previous versions and put them together the way I like to
play the song. I've also fixed the chord issue to sound more like the recording.

4/4 Time
*Notes within “()” are to be played very lightly

In the intro play both lines.  For the verses, play only the second line and repeat the
second line four times as indicated in chord progression.  For the transition, add some
light notes to the first two Am finger patterns.  For example:

   [ch]Am[/ch]                                   
e||------0-(0)-----|
B||------1-(1)-----|
G||------2-(2)-----|
D||----2-----------|
A||--0-------------|
E||----------------|

Throughout all the chords in the chorus you can keep your pinky on the high G note (e
string 3rd fret) to capture the note the piano is playing in the background if you want
a more authentic/full sound.  There should be four accented down strums for each chord
with a light bass note of each chord played in between each strum.
